page.title: 17TRANSPORT, THE TRAMROAD
page.content: An interesting part of the industrial history of the area was the attempt by Christie to built a tramroad over the hills from the upper Tawe valley to Sennybridge. This was intended to transport agricultural lime to the Usk valley but without coal for burning the lime the scheme was doomed to failure. Since Christie did not own land within the Coal Measures he had to lease a mine, which contributed to his bankruptcy. Therefore Claypon completed this horse-drawn tramway which operated until the advent of the Neath and Brecon Railway. It was a 3ft gauge track using short L-shaped lines mounted directly to large flat stones which were the sleepers. These stones with the holes drilleld in them may be seen in some parts of the line. Elsewhere, however, it was completely destroyed by the later railway.
